DataElement.preferredName: Upper-Abdomen Disease Extent Prior to Cytoreduction Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term for the extent of disease in upper-abdomen prior to cytoreduction.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Upper Abdomen Disease or Disorder Extent Prior To Cytoreductive Surgery
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two._The portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time._Earlier in time or order._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A surgical procedure that refers to the removal of as many malignant cells as possible from an anatomic site affected by cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.:The portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis.

Concepts.definition: Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.
The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.

Property.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Extent Prior To Cytoreductive Surgery
Property.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.:Earlier in time or order.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:A surgical procedure that refers to the removal of as many malignant cells as possible from an anatomic site affected by cancer.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A surgical procedure that refers to the removal of as many malignant cells as possible from an anatomic site affected by cancer.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for GYN Surgery form. mc 2/14/17

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A condition in which cancer is spread widely throughout the body.

Concepts.definition: Carcinoma that has spread diffusely to an anatomic site or throughout the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating the presence of more than two tumor masses in a single anatomic site or different anatomic sites.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating the presence of more than two tumor masses in a single anatomic site or different anatomic sites.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
